speaker: VIOLA
text: Save thee, friend, and thy music. Dost thou live

speaker: VIOLA
text: by thy tabor?

speaker: FOOL
text: No, sir, I live by the church.

speaker: VIOLA
text: Art thou a churchman?

speaker: FOOL
text: No such matter, sir. I do live by the church, for I

speaker: FOOL
text: do live at my house, and my house doth stand by the

speaker: FOOL
text: church.

speaker: VIOLA
text: So thou mayst say the king lies by a beggar if a

speaker: VIOLA
text: beggar dwell near him, or the church stands by thy

speaker: VIOLA
text: tabor if thy tabor stand by the church.

speaker: FOOL
text: You have said, sir. To see this age! A sentence is

speaker: FOOL
text: but a chev’ril glove to a good wit. How quickly the

speaker: FOOL
text: wrong side may be turned outward!

speaker: VIOLA
text: Nay, that’s certain. They that dally nicely with

speaker: VIOLA
text: words may quickly make them wanton.

speaker: FOOL
text: I would therefore my sister had had no name,

speaker: FOOL
text: sir.

speaker: VIOLA
text: Why, man?

speaker: FOOL
text: Why, sir, her name’s a word, and to dally with

speaker: FOOL
text: that word might make my sister wanton. But,

speaker: FOOL
text: indeed, words are very rascals since bonds disgraced

speaker: FOOL
text: them.

speaker: VIOLA
text: Thy reason, man?

speaker: FOOL
text: Troth, sir, I can yield you none without words,

speaker: FOOL
text: and words are grown so false I am loath to prove

speaker: FOOL
text: reason with them.

speaker: VIOLA
text: I warrant thou art a merry fellow and car’st for

speaker: VIOLA
text: nothing.

speaker: FOOL
text: Not so, sir. I do care for something. But in my

speaker: FOOL
text: conscience, sir, I do not care for you. If that be to

speaker: FOOL
text: care for nothing, sir, I would it would make you

speaker: FOOL
text: invisible.

speaker: VIOLA
text: Art not thou the Lady Olivia’s Fool?

speaker: FOOL
text: No, indeed, sir. The Lady Olivia has no folly. She

speaker: FOOL
text: will keep no Fool, sir, till she be married, and Fools

speaker: FOOL
text: are as like husbands as pilchers are to herrings: the

speaker: FOOL
text: husband’s the bigger. I am indeed not her Fool but

speaker: FOOL
text: her corrupter of words.

speaker: VIOLA
text: I saw thee late at the Count Orsino’s.

speaker: FOOL
text: Foolery, sir, does walk about the orb like the

speaker: FOOL
text: sun; it shines everywhere. I would be sorry, sir, but

speaker: FOOL
text: the Fool should be as oft with your master as with

speaker: FOOL
text: my mistress. I think I saw your Wisdom there.

speaker: VIOLA
text: Nay, an thou pass upon me, I’ll no more with

speaker: VIOLA
text: thee. Hold, there’s expenses for thee.

speaker: FOOL
text: Now Jove, in his next commodity of hair, send

speaker: FOOL
text: thee a beard!

speaker: VIOLA
text: By my troth I’ll tell thee, I am almost sick for

speaker: VIOLA
text:
one,
                 
                aside
               though I would not have it grow on my

speaker: VIOLA
text: chin.—Is thy lady within?

speaker: FOOL
text: Would not a pair of these have bred, sir?

speaker: VIOLA
text: Yes, being kept together and put to use.

speaker: FOOL
text: I would play Lord Pandarus of Phrygia, sir, to

speaker: FOOL
text: bring a Cressida to this Troilus.

speaker: VIOLA
text: I understand you, sir. ’Tis well begged.

text: The matter I hope is not great, sir, begging but a

speaker: FOOL
text: beggar: Cressida was a beggar. My lady is within, sir.

speaker: FOOL
